channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Coronavirus: First people arriving into UK after rules relaxed for fully jabbed
item.description: People vaccinated in the EU or US do not need to isolate when coming to the UK from an amber country.

item.title: No Covid traces found in railway stations or trains
item.description: Heavily touched areas like escalator handles, ticket machines and benches were swabbed for the virus.

item.title: Hollywood plans £700m film and TV studios in Hertfordshire
item.description: Developers say the site could contribute £300m a year to the local economy and create 4,500 jobs.

item.title: Nottingham church minister's journey from drugs and gang crime
item.description: Paul Traynor is an ordained minister but he was once caught in a cycle of crime, drugs and violence.

item.title: Tyrone Mings says mental health 'plummeted'
item.description: England defender Tyrone Mings says his "mental health plummeted" in the build-up to Euro 2020 because he felt people were doubting his place in the side.

item.title: Cliff collapse at Eype beach prompts warning
item.description: The fall means the beach has been cut off between Eype and Seatown.

item.title: Grenfell Tower: Man accused of burning model to face retrial
item.description: Paul Bussetti will face a new trial after the High Court quashed his previous acquittal.

item.title: Volunteer race marshal dies in Brands Hatch crash
item.description: The marshal died in an accident during a race at the track, leading to the cancellation of the event.

item.title: Classical violinists play 100th lockdown 'doorstep concert'
item.description: Lucy Hewson and Rebecca Prosser started playing to people in their own homes to help fight isolation.

item.title: Gainsborough crash: Man arrested over pedestrian's death
item.description: A 74-year-old man died at the scene of the collision in Gainsborough on Friday night, police say.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Man builds squirrel course in Hitchin garden
item.description: Steve Barley spent almost three months building the course, designed around events in a heptathlon.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: Video: Eggborough Power Station cooling towers demolished
item.description: The 300ft (90m) high structures in Eggborough were demolished as part of a plan to redevelop the site.

item.title: 'Erotic, maybe a bit sexy, but not pornographic'
item.description: Alison Walker signed up for a boudoir photoshoot before having a double mastectomy.

item.title: The autism-friendly toy shop: 'We have got this'
item.description: Retail worker Romilly, who is autistic, wants to create a comfortable space for other autistic people to shop in.

item.title: Dorset photographer shoots Star Wars Lego in cinematic style
item.description: A 34-year-old Dorset photographer is recreating cinematic sci-fi scenes using his Star Wars Lego kits.

item.title: 'Bennerley Viaduct has Facebook followers in Germany'
item.description: The Victorian rail bridge was almost demolished but now has fans all over the world.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Corby BMX centre 'so proud' of British medals
item.description: Mandy Young set up an urban sports centre after her son was attacked and had his skateboard stolen.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team eventing gold for GB while Laura Kenny and Laura Muir progress
item.description: Great Britain win a first Olympic team eventing gold since 1972 while the women's team pursuit gets off to a promising start.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain eventers win team gold for first time in 49 years
item.description: Great Britain win Olympic team eventing gold for the first time in 49 years and are well placed for individual medals later on Monday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty to take short break to mentally recharge before busy 2022
item.description: British swimmer Adam Peaty is taking a month-long break from the sport to protect his mental health and recharge before a push for more success in 2022.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jessica Gadirova finishes sixth and Jennifer seventh on floor as Jade Carey takes gold
item.description: Great Britain's Jessica Gadirova finishes sixth and twin Jennifer seventh in the Olympic gymnastics floor final as American Jade Carey takes gold.
